ygData.subject: Re: Runed Bone Fork......
ygData.msgSnippet: Too many people play D&D and assume heh.. ... ______________________________________________________ Get Your Private, Free Email at http://www.hotmail.com
ygData.messageBody:
Too many people play D&D and assume heh..


>From: "RaceFace" <bean@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Runed Bone Fork......
>Date: Fri, 7 Jan 2000 18:23:58 -0600
>
>
>It's a Staff Of Writhing, not Withering!
>
>Call me anal, but it annoys me. :)
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: "John Tatsukawa" <jht@...>
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Sent: January 7, 2000 11:54
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Runed Bone Fork......
>
>
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Ryan Honeyman [mailto:honeyman@...]
> > > Sent: Friday, January 07, 2000 9:30 AM
> > > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Runed Bone Fork......
> > <cut>
> > > I offered my useless Staff of Withering, and he jumped on it.
> > > A much better deal for him, than I. Those staves are worth
> > > a lot more than the fork.
> >
> > A very nice deal. At least on Bertox the Staff of Withering is worth
>around
> > 500 pp or so. I'm sure it's cheaper on the older servers. This guy had a
> > pretty nice deal going.
> >
> > > Then greed set in.
> > <cut>
> > > Then more greed set in.
> >
> > Lol, why do you think the recent spat of gameshows are doing so well
>here
>in
> > the US? The popular gameshow "Greed" has the host asking contestents,
>"Do
> > you feel the need for greed?"
> >
> > I guess this guy was saying, "Yes!"
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Ryan Honeyman [mailto:honeyman@...]
> > > Sent: Friday, January 07, 2000 8:20 AM
> > > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Runed Bone Fork......
> > >
> > >
> > > > I believe it comes from the same Froglok Squire (thats not
> > > his name) in
> > > > Upper Guk I asked about...
> > >
> > > Now that's funny. They should put that on the EQ Guide Application.
> > >
> > > Which mob drops the runed bone fork?
> > >
> > > a) scryer
> > > b) squire
> > > c) scribe
> >
> > Can I use a lifeline?
> >
> > It's, b) squire. Yes, Regis, that's my final answer. :-)
> >
> > ---Windleaf
> >
> > P.S.
> > My wife loves these shows, I can't avoid them. I prefer "Win Ben Stein's
> > Money" myself. Have we gotten far enough off topic on this? Sorry
>Squire!
